H5637.def: = state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5258.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid, ≈ exclusively used for libations

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2622.def: = action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H6814.def: = town; ◄ located in {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>} delta of {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}; ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H2609.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}, located on an island in the {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>}, south of {L:Memphis<SDBH:מֹף>}

H887.def: = process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H5828.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts)  ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H5045.def: =  an area of land located in the south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples - initially by the Canaanites in {L:Arad<SDBH:עֲרָד>} and the {L:Amelekites<SDBH:עֲמָלֵקִי>}, later, the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H3918.def: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} ≈ seen as a strong and fearless animal

H660.def: exact meaning unknown: = type of viper; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H8314.def: = reddish brown viper with a pale underside and a row of pale blotches arranged side-by-side in pairs all the way down its back; it grows to about 80 centimeters  in length, and its head is smaller and its body thinner than most typical vipers; it is easily provoked and quite aggressive; it is active mainly in the daytime, as it can stand higher temperatures than many other snakes; it lives in desert and grassland areas and feeds on jerboas, mice, and mole rats; its venom is slow-acting but highly poisonous; ◄ |iEchis coloratus|i*; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3802.def: = the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

H5895.def: = young male {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}; ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H1707.def: = rounded protuberance on the back of a camel or dromedary

H1581.def: = large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H7385.def: = state in which a container does not contain anything

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H314.def: = pertaining to being located behind other objects in a row

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4805.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of someone to which they had formerly been subjected

H3586.def: = action by which humans say things that not true in order to deceive or mislead others

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7203.def: = someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2374.def: = someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H5229.def: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2513.def: = object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

H4123.def: = words that are untrue ► and intended to deceive other people

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H3868.def: literally: (qualities) turn from (someone's) eyes; hence: = process by which people begin to lose active knowledge of certain qualities

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6556.def: = large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1158.def: = process by which fire causes a liquid to reach the temperature at which it bubbles and turns to vapour

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H6621.def: = a very short interval of time

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H3807.def: = causative action by which humans use excessive power to break an object into little pieces

H2789.def: = container ◄ made of baked clay; ► used for household activities, in sacrificial rituals, and for the storage of documents; ≈ regarded as of low value

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2846.def: = causative action by which humans take small objects from a particular location with an object shaped like a shovel ► in order to transfer them to another location

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H2834.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H1360.def: = a depression at the bottom of a waterbody, ► where water can still be found even when most of the water has dried up

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7729.def: literally: turning; hence: = process by which humans change their mind about a certain matter, ► which usually results in a different course of action

H5183.def: = action by which humans move down from a place of higher elevation

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H985.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H1606.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3498.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects remain in a certain place after part of the original quantity has been located elsewhere

H8650.def: = pole; ► used to carry a banner

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5251.def: = a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3906.def: = causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

H4175.def: = rain that falls from mid-October until early November; ► moistens the soil and makes it soft to facilitate plowing and sowing; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H3670.def: = action by which deities make themselves unavailable

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H541.def: = action by which humans turn to the right, when walking or performing another event; ≈ in extension: to choose one option as opposed to another

H8041.def: = action by which humans turn to the {L:left<SDBH:שְׂמֹאל>}, when walking or performing another event; ≈ in extension: to choose one option as opposed to another

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2930.def: = process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6826.def: = thin layer of precious metal ► for covering artifacts

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H6456.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H642.def: = thin object covering something else, either entirely or in part

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H1739.def: = female person discharging blood and other material from the lining of the uterus at intervals of about one lunar month; ≈ regarded as ritually unclean

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6627.def: = excrement; ◄  produced by humans and animals; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H1879.def: = state in which plants and their products are full of the juices and condiments that cause them to be of a good quality and in a healthy condition

H8082.def: literally: fatling; hence: = a young animal that has been fattened to prepare it for slaughter, either for food or sacrifice

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4735.def: = an animate or inanimate object ◄ acquired by humans by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H3733.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a young male sheep

H504.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H5895.def: = young male {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}; ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2548.def: = state in which animal food has been mixed with salt ► in order to make it more tasty

H1098.def: = mixture ◄ consisting of entire plants, including leaves, stalks, and grain; ► served as food for domestic animals

H7371.def: = wooden implement with a long, flat blade attached to a long handle, ► for throwing threshed grain into the air so that the wind might separate the straw and chaff from the grain; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad

H4214.def: = wooden fork-like implement, with five to seven prongs, ► for throwing threshed grain into the air so that the wind might separate the straw and chaff from the grain; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H6388.def: = a body of flowing water, ◄ probably dug by humans

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2988.def: = course of impetuously flowing water; ≈ probably evokes the image of seasonal streams fed by rain, assuring agricultural growth, a sign of God's blessing

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2027.def: = the killing of people in a cruel and violent way

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H3842.def: used in poetry only; literally: the white one; hence: = one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night

H2535.def: = state in which the sun produces an extremely high temperature

H7659.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H4273.def: = injury, ◄ usually sustained by being struck with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones

H4347.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3514.def: = state in which objects are relatively heavy

H4858.def: = process by which a substance rises upward; ≈ only used for smoke

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

26.gl: to be filled > to be engaged

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H2673.def: = state in which an object is divided into two or more parts

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5130.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H5299.def: = a shallow, flat circular container with a mesh bottom made of straw, cord, strips of bark, or reed, through which fine particles can pass while the grain is retained; ► used in the final stage of the winnowing process; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H7448.def: = set of ropes or leather straps; ► fitted over the head of a horse and connected to the {L:bit<SDBH:מֶתֶג>}; used to steer the horse

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H2282.def: = celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8057.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2485.def: = a high-pitched wind instrument consisting of a tube with holes along it, ◄ usually made of wood

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1935.def: = state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5183.def: = action by which humans move down from a place of higher elevation

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2197.def: = state in which humans are exceedingly angry to the extent that it is visible in their appearance

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H5311.def: exact meaning unknown; literally: breaking; hence, possibly: = process by which copious amounts of rain flow from the sky, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

H2230.def: = process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H1259.def: = pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H4145.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H8596.def: = musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H8573.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H865.def: = reference to the day before the current day; sometimes used to refer to a point of time in the recent past as if it happened the day before

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H4071.def: = quantity of objects lying one on another

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H1614.def: = a pale yellow substance which burns readily in air; ◄ it is found in regions of volcanic activity such as the Dead Sea area, and ► causes the land to be infertile; ≈ it is  associated with punishment from God

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire
